item.description:
Members of Greater Boston Humanists (formerly known as the Humanist Association of Massachusetts) and Greater Worcester Humanists will be celebrating Darwin Day on February 12, 2009 (the 200th birthday of Charles Darwin), by getting together in Framingham. The main attraction will be a talk by renowned author Daniel Dennett at Framingham State College, starting at 7 p.m. at the Dwight Performing Arts Center at the college. Admission is $5, to be paid at the door. We are not sure of the audience capacity, so you might want to arrive early.

All GWH and GBH members are welcome, and it's likely that we will find a place to have a drink and socialize afterwards. This is an informal get-together, but might be a good chance to meet and get to know some other Bay State humanists. If you're not doing anything else on the night of Darwin's bicentennial, please join us.

GBH and GWH are both chapters of the American Humanist Association www.americanhumanist.org.
item.name: Join Boston and Worcester Humanists for Daniel Dennett lecture
